title: Participatory Online Teaching Method Design for Technology Integration and Learner Identity Development

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Teaching competency enhancement course for pre-service or in-service teachers. Primarily targets professionals in healthcare, legal, and technical fields, promoting technology integration and identity development through offline collaborative activities in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of technological tools on the learning process by utilizing Participatory Action Research (PAR) methodology.
Learners can design educational scenarios that strengthen learner identity by applying instructional methods based on modern e-learning theories.
Learners can propose instructional improvement plans reflecting peer feedback through smartphone-based collaborative activities.

resources: Case Analysis Materials (Examples of Educational Impact of Technology Integration)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
